subject: Psychology
title: Deep Sleep (NREM Stage 3)
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Deep Sleep (NREM Stage 3).

hook.text: Try waking someone in deep sleep. They're confused, disoriented, barely conscious. The brain is doing critical work.

buildup.text: NREM Stage 3 is deep sleep, marked by slow delta waves. It's the hardest stage to wake from.

discovery.text: Deep sleep repairs tissue, strengthens immunity, and lets the brain clear metabolic waste via the glymphatic system.

twist.text: Deep sleep declines with age. By 70, you may get 70% less deep sleep than at 20 â€” with real cognitive costs.

climax.text: Lost deep sleep can't be replaced by sleeping longer. Quality matters as much as quantity.

punchline.text: Deep sleep cleans the brain. Lose it and the waste accumulates.

quiz.question: What happens during deep NREM Stage 3 sleep?
options: The brain clears waste via the glymphatic system
Vivid dreams and rapid eye movements occur
